Cold, late night so long ago when I was not so strong you know A pretty man came to me I never seen eyes so blue You know, I could not run away it seemed we'd seen each other in a dream Seemed like he knew me...he looked right through me...yeah "Come on home, girl" he said with a smile "you don't have to love me yet, let's get high awhile But try to understand...try to understand Try, try, try to understand...I'm a magic man" Winter nights we sang in tune Played inside the months of moon "Never think of never...let this spell last forever" Well, summer lover passed to fall tried to realize it all Mama says she's worried...growing up in a hurry "Come on home, girl" Mama cried on the phone "Too soon to lose my baby yet, my girl should be at home" But try to understand...try to understand Try, try, try to understand...he's a magic man, Mama...ah...he's a magic man "Come on home, girl" he said with a smile "I cast my spell of love on you, a woman from a child" But try to understand...try to understand.. Oh...oh....try, try, try to understand... He's a magic man...oh...he's got the magic hands "Come on home, girl" he said with a smile "You don't have to love me yet, let's get high awhile" But try to understand....try to understand Try, try, try to understand...he's a magic man...yeah...oh...
Everytime I hear this song I nearly die laughing. It reminds me so bad of my friend Matthew, w/his blue eyes and "magic hands".

I'm reading, "A Brief History of Time," by Stephen W. Hawking.
Fascinating stuff.
The concepts are big, but it's written for a non-scientific audience, and the writing is actually very simple. He's explaining the progressing theories from Aristotle to the big scientific players such as Newton and Einstein.
I like the theory on causation (prior actions in time cause reactions later in time) and the expanding universe. That if the universe is expanding, it's obviously not static, and if it is expanding, at one point it was smaller, and, logically, it had to have a starting point, since the process can't be reversed in the same way it's progressing now, and work out. In other words, if the universe is getting progressively larger, you reverse that process to see what it was like earlier in time, and find that you can't make the universe infinitely small. It had to start at one point, at one size.
That was my own explanation, it made more sense in the book, I think.
I'm trying to grap the concept of what exactly they mean by the "ether" (a substace -not air- that exists everywhere, even in "empty" space, through which light waves travel). So light waves through ether is comparable to how sound waves travel through air. However, Einstein said that you didn't need ether (it might not exist) if you don't believe in absolute time. Also, that you can't travel faster than the speed of light, if that is even possible.
It's all just really good stuff. I haven't been able to stop thinking about physics since I started thinking about it a few weeks ago. I just borrowed the Hawking book this morning, I can't wait to read more.

Grab what happiness you can, while you can.

Yesterday sucked. I had a migraine from about 10 AM yesterday to 11 AM today. Finally rid of all but a little lingering squeezing.
I didn't really get to hang out with ole Spooky. The hideous boss-beast made him work a double. So I ended up driving him to the bank, pharmacy, stopping at the toy store, and back to work. This was just as well, since I could hardly see or keep my eyes open, it would have been a short night anyway. He thought I was mad at him, but really I was just sick and too sick to properly explain it.
He scared the crap out of me by squeaking and squealing. I thought he had lit himself on fire with his cigarette. Turns out he had just seen the copy of Hellbound: Hellraiser 2 sitting there on the seat. I rented it from the video store. I told him I'd lend it to him, if he gets it back to me by early next week.
I had better go. I need to get ready for work at 4:30. Now that I'm getting hours again, I love my job. It rules.
A side note: why are all these virgins so anxious for me to see them get deflowered, or as they put it "railed"? I hate popups.

I woke up feeling like a reanimated corpse. Puffy and exhausted and half of my head pounding with a nasty little migraine.
Dragged my way through all 3 classes. I got my art history paper back - that one I wrote in one night. 95 = A. Sweeeeeet.
I visted Adam for a few minutes between class and work. He says his super juju bracelet is working for him. I'm happy. I couldn't get him out of my car... he made me five minutes late for work. It was OK though.
I'm really looking forward to tomorrow. I haven't really hung out with him in days, and I'm picking him up after work and we're gonna go eat or whatever.
Steve asked me if I knew any Wiccans. Sounded like a bet. Haha. I said I did, that it wasn't quite my thing, but filled him in on some details. He says his wife is interested. She sounds more like the type that should just start out with some herbalism, rather than converting to a quasi-religion. Not my say, just my opinion.
Work kicked ass. I started to feel a lot better. I made $29 in sales incentives. Yesterday I made about $26. The paycheck they arrive in will be SWEET, that's for sure.
There's a couple songs I can't get out of my head. Marionettes - Absolution, The Mission U.K. - Neverland, and Bauhaus - Stigmata Martyr:

In a crucifiction ecstasy Lying cross chequed in agony Stigmata bleed continuously Holes in head, hands, feet, and weep for me Stigmata oh you sordid sight Stigmata in your splintered plight Look into your crimson orifice In holy remembrance In scarlet bliss In nomine patri et filii et spiriti sanctum In nomine patri et filii et spiriti sanctum In nomine patri et filii et spiriti sanctum In nomine patri et filii et spiriti sanctum Father, son, and holy ghost Stigmata Martyr

My translation: In the name of the father, both of the son and of the sacred spirit.
Now there's a complete sentence - or not. Something about the case seems off. Patri is a 3rd Declention masculine noun, which means with the "i" ending, it's dative, which is a direct object. Shouldn't it be genitive?! Grrr. His pronunciation is fairly hideous too. Haha. Probably learned church-Latin. Oh, the shame. Still a fab song. I think I'll drag that into class tomorrow and make Witucki translate it. She'll know.

So I worked last night. This dude Lonnie... wow. OK, he's older, and I swear. He tells me he might be leaving for another better-paying job. I can ONLY HOPE he leaves. I think he likes me. He's doing that "close-talking" thing that freaks me. You can tell he fancies himself a ladies' man.
The funniest thing? He looks SO MUCH like the southern guy in "Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil". Now that Adam's hair is a little longer, he looks like a young skinny John Cusack. I want to put them together and be like, "NOW ACT OUT THE MOVIE!" LMAO. Great.
I'm planning to do a block of old blues tomorrow on my show as a tribute to Black History Month. I was planning on playing two or three songs and matching them up with modern rock song that were inspired or influenced by them. Everyone is quick to divvy up "Black" vs. "White" music, and there's a lot more cross-influence that you might think. It's also unfair to call it "stealing," since immitation is flattery, up to a point.
Oh well.

Hmmm... so today I went to classes and worked. I should be studying reflexive Latin pronouns and other such sundries for my test on Friday, but it's so much more fun not to - but I NEED to.
I blew the speakers in the booth today. That was fun... thankfully it wasn't permanent. I had them at full blast, I could feel the vibrations in my lungs, it was great. Suddenly, nothing. The needles on the board were still moving, so I assumed we were still broadcasting, that it wasn't the deck that went down. I overloaded the speakers. Nice.
Tomorrow I have to talk to the guy. Hopefully he doesn't do anything to piss me off, because in that case I just won't say anything, and we'll be set back. So... we'll see.

I figured it out. I'm not asexual, I'm just English.
Anywhos. I think I figured out my confusing situation. I'm through with Chris - he totally burned me today. I saw him up at the mall, he went into Hot Topic with his friends, and I went in after him. I said hi to Corey, one of the dudes that works there (and you know this girl can be LOUD when she wants to be), and so he MUST have seen me there. Didnt' say hi, didn't come over to see me. So fawk you too. You may be the hottest piece of teenage ass in three counties, but you can't be ignoring me and getting away with it. That's just so much less playtime for you, fancypants.
I gave Adam a ride home. I stopped at BK to get one of those chicken things I like so much (FIVE GRAMS OF FAT!!! THEY'RE SO GOOD!). I bought him a strawberry shake and he disturbed the entire restaurant laughing hysterically at my Hyer-jokes.
In other news: I think one of my professors likes me. I mean, he's very good-looking FOR HIS AGE. That says it all right there.
Anyways. I'm probably getting a boyfriend on Thursday. (Haha. I sound like I'm going to the grocery store.) I've known the kid a while, we have fun, and he's been liking me lately, so I think I'm going for it.
This kid Rob checked me out today - totally looked me up and down (I did look nice today). Haha. I worked with him briefly; he was seasonal help. So I saw him up at the mall, chatted with him a bit. He's very funny, cocky in an endearing sort of way. I ditched him to stalk Chris (that hot loser skater boy). He's cute, but I dunno. I'm going with this other guy (who's hair has been looking nice lately).
http://scarybat.livejournal.com/20423.html

Ok, this is going to be an essay-style rant about a subject I can't seem to get off of my mind lately. If (lack of) sex offends you - scroll away now.
SEX SEX SEX
It's all anyone thinks about, so it would seem. What's the traditional line between friends and boy/girl-friends? Sex, right? Even if you're not actually doing it, it's an implied "not doing it yet".
Theories on the rare people that don't care, or don't care very much, range far and wide. Most modern psychologists assume there's simply a problem with the individual, it's a disorder. Maybe they were traumatized when young, maybe they're a repressed homosexual (itself considered a disorder not long ago). Proponents (mostly members) of the asexual theory insist it's all right, and doesn't mean there's anything wrong with you, it's just different.
"...the definition of asexuality is 'No or low sexual attraction to other people' (http://www.asexuality.org/bigfaq.htm#def1)".
I'm coming to terms with the horrifying fact that this might be me. I remember being about 6 years old and my mother giving a non-detailed speech about sex, and me wrinkling my nose and saying something like, "Ick. I don't ever wanna do that," and she assured me that one day I would. Well, I'm 21, and I can't say a whole lot has changed. Sure, in theory I like sex. I understand why people do it. I also know almost no one turns me on, and in the end it's just too big a bother. You get in a relationship with a guy, and it's just understood there's going to be sex sooner or later (preferrably sooner). Then, you sleep with them, and next thing you know it's all you can do together, everything is just a lead-up to sex. Am I weird for feeling there should be more to life?
The one guy in AGES (we're talking years here) that I felt a definite sexual attraction to (even after getting to know him a little) just doesn't seem to be interested. It would be a supreme irony if he's asexual. There are lots (not to brag) of guys I could have in an instant, but I look at them, and just feel grossed out. Some of them are nice-looking too. I can understand aesthetically, he's a cute guy, but when I think about touching him I just get icked out.
It just seems so easy for everyone else. They find someone they have virtually nothing in common with, who isn't even that good-looking, and they fuck (pardon my French). They seem to find this normal and okay. I pick every tiny detail apart until sex seems like the most retarded thing a pair of people could do.
Well-meaning friends tell me I just, "need a boyfriend," but why should I expose myself to lecherous groping I'm just going to find gross and then have to dump the guy?
This is my dilemma. Sure, maybe it's a phase and I'll grow out of it, but it's been a fucking long phase.

Remember that 2 1/2 page paper I had to write in about 2 hours? The one I didn't research or anything? I got it back yesterday afternoon. I got a 4.9 out of 5, which makes a 98%
HAIL TO THE MASTER!
I am the procrastinatrix. I'm getting good at it.
Today I have to check and see if that job is my new job or not. I need to stop at my current job and see what time I'm working tomorrow. I think it's 9:30 (VOMIT!), but I'm not sure.
I'm probably picking up Adam and taking him to the store to cash his check. At this point I'm tired and would rather skip it, but I promised and now he's probably planned on it. Blah.
All kinds of new guys are in love with me. Well, more like crushes, but none of them interest me. I guess none are cute... It sucks - the ultimately hot ones are first of all, extrememely scarce. Then, if you find one, they tend to be stupid and/or dreadfully conceited. I'm gonna die alone: (
How Goth.

I can't stop eating.
I eat and I eat and I eat. I guess when I was sick, it helped me to stay focused on not fainting or whatever. Now I'm in a bad habit. Getting that damn non-beer beer gut back. GARH!
Today's show was HARD. Man. I went in there with no idea, just a wallet of CDs and a few in jewel cases. I played some of the stuff in the studio too. I'm reading some book about High Ceremonial Magick and laughing my ass off at the illustrations. He's reading his toy and horror movie magazines. Then I got him going on this massive joke that Amy was going to call up a demon and make it show customers the LVS. Adam is all like, "It's not gonna," and I'm like, "OH YES IT IS; because it's afraid of Amy. She a much higher demon."
So we had a good laugh imagining all these cartoonish situations. Like, the demon doesn't know who Toby Keith is, and has to ask Curt, and all this stuff. An old man heard us and was laughing and trying to get in on the joke. Haha. It was great.
I feel much better than I did yesterday. I was so incredibly drained yesterday. As I sat in the theatre today, I felt connected. I'm not sure how many people will understand this, but sometimes I get "floaty," like I'm not very well grounded in my body, and I dislike the feeling, because it makes me nervous. It's like when you're JUST about to fall asleep, but all the time. IT SUCKS. Then again, some people are way TOO grounded in their body, to the extent they nearly ARE it. I have wandered far far off any kind of track here.
Anyway, today I called Matthew to see how things were going with him, and he's fine. He was moving out, and his mom made him get off of the phone. Poor kid... he's gonna hate the whole loss of freedom thing. However, I was glad nothing weird was happening to him. Good luck Matt!

So today I read this book, "Still She Haunts Me," about the bizarre relationship between Lewis Caroll (author of Alice in Wonderland) and the little girl he based Alice on. Rather Nabokov-ish in nature, even though it seems he never actually does anything to her. I didn't feel like paying $12.50 for it, so I just sat in B&N and read it in an hour or two.
I went back to the mall and wandering into Spencers, where I found a Niobe action figure from the Matrix movies. Adam is gonna pee. He'll give me the money for it, so I grabbed it. I remember him kvetching about wanting one, because it's supposedly the rare one, only one per case! Gah - I've been friends with him so long... I know too much. I called him and his mum today, and updated them. He was highly indignant at the pet-store-dude incident. I was like, "...and he was all like, 'Can I call you?' all like we're gonna fricken go out for malted milkshakes. Like, what the FUCK do you know about me?! I'll malted milkshake YOU!" The people nearby looked at me, AS IF they haven't heard that threat before. Haha. So Adam said if he managed to get my number and calls, just to tell him I have to go hang out with my best friend. Hahaha. His Mum was getting all worried, like she thinks he's a psycho. I was like, "Noo... I don't think he's dangerous." LOL. She's such a sweetie.
I saw Butterfly Effect yesterday. I can honestly say that is the best movie I have seen in ages. It's just so good, not even Ashton Kutcher could ruin it, and I thought he might. I'm just so used to seeing him play dorkuses, it's hard to take him serious. Plus, he just looks like a skinny Hyer (and we all know how hilarious I find the antics of Hyer, human monkey). GREAT plot though. WOW. I'm gonna see it again.
I had bizarre dreams last night. I think I'm using one as the jump-off for a twisted short story. Also, I need to draw this one thing I saw the night before. It's really messed up, like Hellraiser meets Tim Burton.

My mom is SO WEIRD.
Ok, so I had to go with her to drop my car off, because otherwise I'd have to sit in the lobby of the car place for five or so hours. We went to this pet store where she had to exchange something. This dude asks me if I need help, I asked about their selection of newts. They had some Japanese Firebellys, but no Eastern Red Spotted, which is the one I think I want. Not that I'm buying now - maybe in the summer.
Anyways, next thing you know my mom's in on the conversation, and she's talking to him, and next thing I know I hear, "You like her?" and I'm all, "OH SHIT."
See, she really doesn't want me to date, but at the same time, she wants to be in on the descision.
The guy is 29, and I'm not sure he had eyebrows. I like my guys to have eyebrows.
He was a nice-seeming guy. Totally loves animals, which is cool, but even had he been drop-dead goodlooking - TWENTY-NINE?! That's almost 30, and 30 represents a whole different bracket. Thirty is marrying age, thirty is having kids age, thirty is In-Ten-Years-I'm-Gonna-Be-Middle-Age. NO THANKEE. So, spurred on my mother, he asked if he could call me. I thought hard, totally spaced for a moment, and said I was really too busy to hang out. He backpeddled quickly. I felt bad for the guy, but I'm not running a charity service, yanno?
So yeah, thirty is too old for me. If anything, I go for the younger ones; )
The older guys get, the less cute they get, generally speaking. They're about as cute as they're ever going to get at around 17-19, then it's usually downhill. How sad.
All the guys at my college are hideous - big lumpy jock types, for the most part. I've seen a couple guys that look nice, but nothing really wowing, and I'm not sure they speak too much English. The only people that know how to dress themselves arn't from America. More sadness.
Mmm. So for the rest of the night I hung out with Matt at the mall. He tried to molest me some more: Lester the Molester. I don't think Matthew takes my interest in Chris seriously just because he's a little younger. That's kind of stupid, Matt's only 19. I also don't think he gets it about how I'm interested in a guy, and I'm not gonna do stuff with other people while I'm trying to get him. Also, not going to do stuff with other people after I get him, if I get him. That's just how I am, I don't like cheaters. Plus, if he found out, and he probably would, it would totally fuck things up, and I really like him so far, so I don't want that.
I'm all on about this boy, all the time, to anyone who will listen. Yeah, I'm becoming that person. The more I talk to him, he calms down a little. He's been all over the place. When I first met him, like at the store, he was pretty calm, used to ask me about bands and where stuff was. Then this fall when I started showing an interest in him, I think that rattled his cage, because he got real hyper and weird everytime I'd try to talk to him. Must be nerves. Now, I think he's getting used to me and/or trying to play it cool. Once we can actually have conversations, I'll see if he's smart or not. I think he might be. I'm so excited. SQUEE.
Like, I hate talking on the phone, and I actually want to call him.
